custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects 'Add Widget' from the app homescreen or app tray
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the At Bat widget in the drawer of available widgets
And the user should be able to add it to their homescreen.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user adds the MLB widget to their homescreen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the current day's games should load in the main window of the widget
And each game should have:
The game time with time zone
Away team above home team
Team records

The widget should have:
Date being shown
number of games in schedule for day. (eg. 1/15 or 4/10 etc.)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the Up/down arrows on the widget
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the main view of the widget should refresh to show the next/previous game in the widget
And when the user reaches the beginning or end of the list of games the user should be brought to the other end of the list 
(ie. Tapping up on game 1 of 6 should bring user to game 6 of 6)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When there is a game in progress
And the game data is updating
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the runs hits and errors should be updating according to the refresh rate set in the app settings 
(check each refresh rate)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a game has gone final in the scoreboard data
And the user views that game in the scoreboard widget
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the widget should show the game state above the teams,
And the Runs, Hits, Errors, should be listed to the right of both teams

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the MLB logo
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be launched into the scoreboard view of At Bat

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on game in Preview state in the widget
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be launched into the Gameday view of At Bat and taken to the preview tab of Gameday

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on game in a Live state in the widget
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to the Live tab of the Gameday view of At Bat for the game they selected.

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user loses their network connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the widget should say "Unable to load data"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user loses their network connection but the widget still shows game data
When the user taps a game in the widget
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the app should open and the user should receive an appropriate lack of connectivity error

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to remove the MLB.com widget
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to remove the widget without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects 'Add Widget' from the app homescreen or app tray
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the At Bat - Teams widget in the drawer of available widgets

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user adds the Teams widget to their homescreen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should see the teams list appear

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has set at least one favorite team in At Bat
And the user attempts to add a team widget to their homescreen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the teams list should show their favorite teams sorted to the top of the list
And the favorite teams should be indicated with a star icon

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user selects a team from the teams list when adding a widget
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the team widget for the selected team should appear in the homescreen location they selected
(Teams widgets should take up 1x1 space)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user adds a widget for each team
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then each team should have the correct icon for their team page
(Verify all teams have correct icons)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user adds a team widget on an Android Handset
And the user taps on the team widget
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken into At Bat and straight to the team page for that team
(Verify each team widget goes to the correct team page)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user adds a team widget on an Android Tablet
And the user taps on the team widget
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken into the app to the scoreboard section
(Repeat for a few teams)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user adds a team widget to their homescreen
And the user adds a second and subsequent team widgets to their homescreen
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then each team widget should maintain their correct icon
And tapping each widget should go to the correct team page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user adds a team widget
And the user restarts their device
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team widget should remain visibly correct and take the user to the correct team page even after a restart

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is on an older version of At Bat and has added one or more team widgets
And the user updates and overwrites At Bat with a newer version
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team widgets should remain visibly correct and take the user to the correct team page even after an app update

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to remove a team widget from their homescoreen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the team widget should be able to be removed
